channel.title: Posts on r-mas
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on r-mas

item.title: Scraping Historical Prices using Bloomberg API
item.description: Introduction This post is a soft update to my previous post on Exploring UITFs in the Philippines. One limitation of that study is that the historical prices used were limited to the past 12 months only. In this post, I’m going to share how to scrape up to 5 years worth of historical prices from Bloomberg.com. Bloomberg “bulk-time-series” API I owe a big thanks to this wonderful article on finding the API by Greg Reda.

item.title: Exploring UITFs in the Philippines
item.description: Introduction This post is the second part of a series of posts about Unit Investment Trust Funds or UITFs in the Philippines. In this post, I’ll dive into the dataset produced in the previous post, looking to answer more specific questions such as: What are the available UITFs in the Philippines? Which banks offer them? What are the different types of UITFs? What are the differences between each type?

item.title: Scraping Web Data on UITFs using R
item.description: Introduction Surveying active UITFs Gathering UITF symbols Cleaning up Introduction This post is an example of scraping the web for specific data we would like to have for analysis. In this example, I’m going to gather data on UITFs in the Philippines. UITFs or Unit Investment Trust Funds are a type of pooled funds, similar but still somewhat different to mutual funds.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: This is my very first blog post. I started this blog so I can share some cool stuff I’ve been working on as I’m discovering my way through data science. I decided to start a blog of my own since I’ve been learning a lot about data science and many things in general from blogs of other people. I believe this is a very efficient way of sharing my own analyses and projects to others and all other people who might find their way here.
